content:
IPphManager Interface

Definition

Provides stop and start control of listener channels.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("1cc9099d-0a8d-41cb-87d6-845e4f8c4e91")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
public interface IPphManager

Remarks

IPphManager is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

Methods

StartProcessProtocolListenerChannel(String,IListenerChannelCallback)

Starts the specified process protocol listener channel.

public void StartProcessProtocolListenerChannel (string protocolId, System.Web.Hosting.IListenerChannelCallback listenerChannelCallback);
protocolId
String

The protocol ID.

listenerChannelCallback
IListenerChannelCallback

The IListenerChannelCallback interface.

Remarks

StartProcessProtocolListenerChannel is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

StopProcessProtocol(String,Boolean)

Stops all protocol listener channels.

public void StopProcessProtocol (string protocolId, bool immediate);
protocolId
String

The protocol ID of the listener channel to stop.

immediate
Boolean

true to notify the process protocol manager to stop all listener channels synchronously; false to stop all listener channels asynchronously.

Remarks

StopProcessProtocol is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

StopProcessProtocolListenerChannel(String,Int32,Boolean)

Stops the specified process protocol listener channel.

public void StopProcessProtocolListenerChannel (string protocolId, int listenerChannelId, bool immediate);
protocolId
String

The protocol ID for the listener channel.

listenerChannelId
Int32

The listener channel ID.

immediate
Boolean

true to notify the process protocol manager to stop all listener channels synchronously; false to stop all listener channels asynchronously.

Remarks

StopProcessProtocolListenerChannel is introduced in the .NET Framework 3.5 . For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.
